references.paper_title: A review of uncertainty quantification in deep learning: Techniques, applications and challenges
references.reason: Provides a comprehensive overview of uncertainty quantification techniques in deep learning, which is essential for understanding the limitations of generative models in image restoration.

Introduces the fundamental concept of the perception-distortion tradeoff, which is central to understanding the limitations in achieving high perceptual quality and low distortion simultaneously in image restoration.
Provides the foundational information theory concepts used in the paper, including entropy, mutual information, and the entropy power inequality.

references.paper_title: A theory of the distortion-perception tradeoff in wasserstein space
references.reason: Extends the perception-distortion tradeoff to the Wasserstein space, providing a more rigorous mathematical framework for analyzing the tradeoff in generative models.

Introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a class of generative models that have shown remarkable success in image generation and restoration tasks, forming the basis for many of the experiments in the paper.
